author: Ian Martin
comment: Please could you develop for other smart watches i.e. LG
title: Peble smart watches only

author: Kevin Croombs
comment: Since switching to android and Google maps for navigation I've missed the camera warnings I had on my old satnav. This is a great replacement.
title: It works

author: Cezar Dri
comment: Works even with my navigation app (be on road) and this app help me avoid thousands of £ in traffic fines really work I was never caught and I am the type of driver that rune over 200 all the time :D,  muchas gracias hermano sigue con el buen trabajo y las actualizaciones. Muchísimas gracias
title: The best,  lo mejor de los mejores

author: Chris Johnson Johnson
comment: Works well with Galaxy S4 and overlays nicely on Google Maps. Only slight negative is that some old camera sites on Motorways still get flagged up.
title: Great App

author: Carl Leach
comment: I installed this yesterday (9th October) and updated the database, which is now showing a database Data version date of 15 July.

reply.author: Nacho Lopez
reply.content: I have just submitted an update for the database. It will be available for download later today. Sorry for the inconvenience!

title: Database Updates

author: Dave J
comment: But not a single indication of it working on Android wear, which was what tempted me to buy it to begin with.
title: It works on the phone

author: Martin Corley
comment: This is really nicely implemented and the alerts are just right - a fine addition to navigation with google maps. However there is a tendency to warn about "traffic light cameras" mid motorway, which is odd - I realize that the db isn't created by the developer but I can't work out which category I need to turn off to stop getting 60% false alarms! Any help appreciated. One other niggle is that the sound is (always?) routed through the phone's speaker - I'd like the choice of using the headphone jack.

reply.author: Nacho Lopez
reply.content:
Hi!

I am aware of the issue you comment, as I had a road trip last week and happened to me too. I am currently trying to figure out this issue. 

About the headphones issue: the audio is routed through the same channels that the music apps use, so there should not be any problem with that. Will check anyway! :)

Thank you for your comment!

title: Useful although the db is full of phantoms

author: Andy Waters
comment: I've had this less than 24hrs. I have found that the audio alerts are so quiet that you can't hear them. Also false alerts. For example in Wroxham Norfolk states there are traffic light signal cameras.  There aren't.  Gives location wrong then pops up again & keeps changing distance before clearing alert just before the real traffic lights. Rubbish. Will pursue for refund.
title: False alerts

author: Denis Plante
comment: Works great so far. Well worth giving a try.
title: Great

author: Ben
comment: Fantastic looking app, functional and picked up the 2 cameras along my route to the shops!      Keep up the work and look forward to seeing more of your work!
title: Looks fantastic!
